title: In The Shawshank Redemption movie, why did Hadley beat down Boggs? - Quora

response.answer_text: Because Byron Hadley is a maladjusted and sadistic brute who will beat on anyone given the slightest opportunity. Granted, Boggs happens to richly deserve such a savage beating as he and his fellow “Sisters” beat Andy Dufresne nearly to death in the latest in a sequence of such attacks, at least some of which probably included rape, or at least attempted rape. Not long before the latter incident Andy tells Hadley about a way he can keep a sum of money he inherited and not lose any to tax. Hadley repays this favor by beating Boggs so badly he renders him an invalid. But Hadley could have just put the word out that Andy was under his protection after Andy does him that huge favor—actually, if I’m not mistaken, this is what happens in the book. But the movie-Hadley waits until after Andy is attacked (it’s not terribly likely Hadley doesn’t know Andy is being victimized by the Sisters) so he can have an excuse to exact violent retribution on Boggs. I think the brutal nature of Hadley was heightened for the film, which I think works better for the story.

It was a simple quid pro quo. Andy did Hadley a huge favor in showing him.the loophole that let him keep his inheritance without paying taxes on it. When Boggs and the sisters put Andy in the hospital, Byron Hadley enacted revenge on Andy’s behalf. He also was a very violent man who reveled in his position of power which allowed him the opportunity to beat the inmates.
